titleStmt.title: The substance of Christian religion soundly set forth in two bookes, by definitions and partitions, framed according to the rules of a naturall method, by Amandus Polanus professor of diuinitie. The first booke concerneth faith. The second concerneth good workes. The principall pointes whereof are contained in a short table hereunto annexed. Translated out of Latin into English by E.W.
Partitionum theologicarum, logica methodo institutarum. English
titleStmt.author: Polanus von Polansdorf, Amandus, 1561-1610.
Wilcocks, Elijahu, b. 1576 or 7.

publicationStmt.publisher: By R. F[ield] for Iohn Oxenbridge dwelling in Paules churchyard, at the signe of the Parrot,

notesStmt.note: A translation, by Elijahu Wilcocks, of: Partitionum theologicarum, logica methodo institutarum.
Identified as STC 20084a on UMI microfilm reel 1252.
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.

place.placeName: Paules churchyard, at the signe of the Parrot
